body: This behavior is intentional because syncing during composition often leads to awkward UX. What's the use case for this?

example:

https://jsfiddle.net/cloudyan/k9qbs068/

Expect type="search" to work like type="text"
That's not a use case... what I am asking is why do you want the in-composition string to show up.

I don't want to the in-composition string to show upÔºàin using type="search"Ôºâ,That's not what I want. I want to be like type="text", but it is not now

![7651e20e-7178-4d3c-bd04-c467b43210fa](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/912821/27251265-38825082-5309-11e7-9a50-63d020f52104.png)
![abd705c4-6d6c-47b0-885f-c877d6968116](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/912821/27251266-38ae9610-5309-11e7-8ef4-f6d35fa0b1aa.png)

rename.to: Inconsistent behavior of v-model sync during IME composition for <input type="search">

body:
@yyx990803 
Android has the same problem , why not handle composition events ?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3386786/29515735-281f6d18-86a0-11e7-8f94-0a0a201bc0de.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3386786/29515918-effc5ca6-86a0-11e7-934c-7d0359cc1716.png)

Just stumbled on this issue myself. Handling composition events in an MVC way does not seem to be doable with current browser behavior. It is a breaker for a live search/live autocompletion functionality.

As of now, the best way for me to handle this was to make a form with input element and re-read it on every compositionupdate event. This seems to be the only hack that works with UC browser. For some reason, UC does update the inputs inside forms on composition, yet it gives undefined as event data...

It will be very very good is there will be a standard way set by upstream how to handle that, and proper explanation of bug's nature across browsers in docs.

For me, I'm afraid, the cross browser solution will involve hardcoded hack for each major browser version.

issue.title: [Bug Report] v-text-field not wait chinese input method (IME) input to end when use v-model bind a computed attribute

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Functionality that does not work as intended/expected

labels.name: platform specific
labels.description: The issue only occurs on a specific platform

issue.body: ### Versions and Environment **Vuetify:** 1.3.11 **Vue:** 2.5.17 **Browsers:** Maxthon 5.2.5.4000, Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, Opera, Other **OS:** iOS, Mac OSX ### Steps to reproduce 1. a v-text-field use v-model bind a computed attribute ``` ``` 2. change input value in set method of computed attribute ``` data: ()=>({ inputValue: '' }), computed: { inputFormatted: { get(){ return this.inputValue }, set(val) { this.inputValue = val.toUpperCase() } } } ``` 3. The code in set method will break the default chinese input method in iOS and macOS, which will prevent you from entering Chinese character ### Expected Behavior text field wait IME input to end ### Actual Behavior text field interrupts the input of IME and can't input chinese character ### Reproduction Link https://codepen.io/lazylz/pen/WYgmBb ### Other comments This problem can also occur in other languages that require an IME (Japanese, Korean etc.) this issue not happened on native input tagÔºåbecause v-model waits input method input to end (use compositionend event) before it refresh value
